abstract: Yury Baumblit and Edwin Elie, operators of so-called three-quarter houses across New York City, are arraigned on charges including felony fraud and illegal eviction of tenants and could face up to four years in prison; Baumblit and his wife Rimma were indicted in May on charges of money laundering and Medicaid fraud in connection with management of Back on Track, company through which the halfway houses were run.
lead_paragraph: Yury Baumblit, who along with his wife was indicted on money laundering charges, has now been charged with illegally evicting tenants.

headline.main: Man Who Ran Flophouses Facing New Fraud Charges
headline.print_headline: Ex-Operator of Flophouses Faces New Set of Charges

snippet: Yury Baumblit, who along with his wife was indicted on money laundering charges, has now been charged with illegally evicting tenants.
